title: non_fmt_panics suggestion breaks for some const functions

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

labels.name: D-invalid-suggestion
labels.description: A structured suggestion resulting in incorrect code

body:
I tried this code:

```rust
#![feature(const_panic)]
#![warn(non_fmt_panics)]
pub const fn foo(explanation: &'static str) {
    panic!(explanation);
}
```

This provides a suggestion to replace the code with:

```rust
    panic!("{}", explanation);
```

However, this will not compile in a const function:

```
error[E0658]: function pointer casts are not allowed in constant functions
 --> src/lib.rs:4:18
  |
4 |     panic!("{}", explanation);
  |                  ^^^^^^^^^^^
  |
  = note: see issue #57563 <https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/57563> for more information
  = help: add `#![feature(const_fn_fn_ptr_basics)]` to the crate attributes to enable
  = note: this error originates in the macro `$crate::const_format_args` (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info)

error[E0015]: calls in constant functions are limited to constant functions, tuple structs and tuple variants
 --> src/lib.rs:4:5
  |
4 |     panic!("{}", explanation);
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  |
  = note: this error originates in the macro `$crate::const_format_args` (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info)
```

I'm not actually sure what the correct suggestion should be, since `panic_any` is not const.

Found during the 2021 crater run for:
* https://crater-reports.s3.amazonaws.com/pr-87190-3/try%23a7a572ce3edd6d476191fbfe92c9c1986e009b34/reg/swiss-army-knife-0.0.22/log.txt
